scheme_name: Printing and Free Distribution of Sanskrit Textbooks
brief_description: The scheme aims to support sanskrit school students by providing annual textbook financial aid ranging from ₹250 to ₹700.
detailed_description: The "Printing and Free Distribution of Sanskrit Textbooks" scheme was launched by the Department of Sanskrit Education, Government of Uttarakhand. It aims to promote sanskrit education by providing financial assistance for textbooks to students studying in Sanskrit-medium schools. Under this scheme, students from classes 1st to 12th receive annual monetary support ranging from ₹250/- to ₹700/- based on their class level.
benefits: Classes 1 st to 5 th : ₹250/- per student Classes 6 th to 8 th : ₹400/- per student Classes 9 th to 10 th : ₹600/- per student Classes 11 th to 12 th : ₹700/- per student
The amount is provided annually to cover the cost of Sanskrit textbooks.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a student. The applicant should be enrolled in a Sanskrit-medium school recognized by the Government of Uttarakhand. The applicant should be studying in classes 1 st to 12 th.

steps: Registration Process: Step 1: Visit to e-Services Apuni Sarkar ( https://eservices.uk.gov.in ) and click "Sign Up" on the Citizen Login page. Step 2: Fill in the registration form with your name, email, mobile number, etc., and click Submit. Step 3: You will receive your User ID and password via SMS on your registered mobile number.  Application Process: Step 1: Navigate to the Citizen Login page and enter your User ID (email or mobile) and password, complete the captcha, then click Sign In. Step 2: Once logged in, your dashboard appears. Click "Apply for New Application" or similar to begin. Step 3: Choose the Fisheries department, from the list, select the specific scheme you wish to apply for. Step 4: The portal will list mandatory documents required and upload mandatory documents, after uploading, click Submit to proceed. Step 5: Enter all required details in the form (personal, land, bank, etc.). Use Save to save progress, preview to review, or Delete Draft to reset. Step 6: Once all fields are accurately filled, click Submit. You will receive an Application ID receipt, which you can download.  Track Application and Approval: Step 1: The application goes to the concerned department for review. Step 2: You can track your application status on the portal using your Application ID.
NOTE: The application fill  during the academic session for which assistance is being claimed.

documents_required: Aadhaar Card of the Student. Bank Account Details. Any Other Document if Required.
